name: 5-4-3-2-1 Grounding Technique
description: A sensory awareness exercise to return to the present moment and reduce anxiety

onSelect.message: Let's ground ourselves together. This technique will help you feel present üßò

onStart.message: Take a deep breath. Let's focus on the present moment together.

onComplete.message: I hope you feel more centered. Remember this tool whenever you feel overwhelmed.

onSave.message: Your grounding practice has been saved. You can return to this anytime you need üå∏

sections.title: Acknowledge FIVE things you see
sections.placeholder: Look around you. What do you notice?

onStart.message: Take a slow breath in... and out. Now, look around you. What do you see? üëÅÔ∏è

onComplete.message: Good. You're becoming aware of your surroundings. Let's continue... üåø

hints: Notice colors, shapes, and textures
Look for details you might normally overlook
There's no right or wrong - just observe
Take your time with each observation

1.message: One thing noticed. Breathe... keep looking üå∏

3.message: You're bringing yourself into the present moment üßò

sections.title: Acknowledge FOUR things you can touch
sections.placeholder: Notice the texture and temperature around you.

onStart.message: Another breath. Now, what can you feel? Touch the surfaces around you ü§≤

onComplete.message: Feel the connection between you and the physical world üåç

hints: Notice the texture - smooth, rough, soft, hard?
Is it warm or cool to the touch?
Feel the fabric of your clothes
Notice the ground beneath your feet
Touch your hands together and notice the sensation

4.message: Your nervous system is calming. Well done üíö

sections.title: Acknowledge THREE things you can hear
sections.placeholder: Pay attention to the sounds in your environment.

onStart.message: Close your eyes if you'd like. Listen... what sounds do you hear? üëÇ

onComplete.message: The world is full of sound. You're here, present in this moment üéµ

hints: Listen for distant sounds, then close sounds
Notice the quiet sounds beneath the obvious ones
Your own breathing counts
Maybe a clock ticking, wind, or voices?
Don't judge the sounds - just notice them

3.message: You're anchored in the present through sound üîî

sections.title: Acknowledge TWO things you can smell
sections.placeholder: What scents are present right now?

onStart.message: Breathe in slowly through your nose. What do you smell? üå∏

onComplete.message: Scent connects us to memory and place. You're right here, right now üçÉ

hints: It might be subtle - your clothes, the air, your skin
Maybe coffee, fresh air, or something cooking?
If you can't smell much, that's okay - notice that
Sometimes we can smell our own hair products or soap
The absence of scent is also worth noting

1.message: One more scent to notice... breathe in üå∫

2.message: Your senses are bringing you home to yourself üè°

sections.title: Acknowledge ONE thing you can taste
sections.placeholder: Can be a sip of water or just noticing the taste in your mouth.

onStart.message: Take a sip of water if you have it, or just notice the taste in your mouth üíß

onComplete.message: You've completed the grounding sequence. Well done üôè

hints: The taste might be very subtle
Notice any lingering flavors from what you ate or drank
Even the taste of your own mouth counts
You could take a sip of water to notice taste more clearly
There's no wrong answer here

1.message: Perfect. You've engaged all five senses ‚ú®

sections.title: Post-Exercise Check-in
sections.placeholder: How has your emotional state shifted? What do you notice in your body and mind now?

onStart.message: Take a moment to notice how you feel now. What's different? üåø

onComplete.message: This awareness is powerful. You're learning to regulate yourself üíú

onSkip.message: That's okay. The important work has been done üå∏

hints: Is your breathing slower or deeper?
Do you feel more settled in your body?
Has the anxious feeling reduced even a little?
What physical sensations do you notice?
Are your thoughts clearer or quieter?
It's okay if you don't feel dramatically different

60.message: This reflection deepens the practice. Beautiful work üå∏

100.message: Your insight is profound. Keep coming back to this practice üíé
